Controls/Automation Engineer 
Wayfair is a leader in e-commerce selling furniture and home goods mostly online.  We are seeking a motivated and talented Controls Engineer to join our team.  This position will  drive change and implement complex solutions that impact an entire fulfillment network.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and teamwork abilities
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies
Previous internship or project experience in control systems is a plus
Experience 2+ years in field engineering/application material handling field 
Knowledge of power of control hardware and mechanical design 
Capability to troubleshoot hardware systems, components, devices, etc.
Strong written, visual, and verbal communication skills. Effectively communicating with business partners 
CEMA Standards, NFPA79, ISO 13849 familiarity

Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.

Title: Product Manager, Network and Security
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position must be based in Toronto, Canada and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements (T/W/TH in office).
 
Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. These experiences are driven by a cutting-edge set of data and machine learning, analytics, and operational systems that work in an integrated fashion to deliver a world class shopping experience for our customers. Business applications of these systems span many fields including recommendations, marketing, supply chain optimization and merchandising. These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for configurability for rapid testing and exploration. 
We are looking for a seasoned Product Manager to join our Platforms Product team working on multiple facets of our Employee Technology Solutions. These solutions are leveraged by all our employees when developing awesome experiences for our customers and suppliers, or when serving their needs.
Particularly, this person will be joining our  internal employee technology teams responsible for planning, executing and handing off large, complex, cross-functional technology dedicated to serve our employees across our operations. These teams own everything from employee onboarding and continued productivity support, productivity tools, asset management and in-office experiences. The goal of this team is to solve dynamic technology needs for Wayfairians everywhere by providing them a frictionless technology support experience.
We are looking for a Technical Product Manager to define and execute the strategy for our networking, security, cloud, and observability solutions. This role is crucial for delivering secure, efficient, and cost-effective solutions that support thousands of users at Wayfair. The focus areas include:

Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) & Application Security: Enable secure access and protect critical data.
Cloud Networking & SD-WAN: Improve network performance and scalability.
FinOps (Cost Optimization): Drive cost efficiencies in our infrastructure.
Network Observability & CCaaS: Enhance operational insights and customer interactions.

The goal of these technologies is to boost security, streamline operations, reduce costs, and improve the overall user experience. These technologies are used to support mission critical systems, hence requiring a person who can balance operational efficiency along with continuous improvement goals. This person will work with cross-functional teams and leaders, including operations, science teams, engineers, analysts, on capabilities needed for efficient operations while enabling technologies for reimagining our customer and supplier experiences.
What Youll Do:

Own the product strategy & roadmap, specifically define & drive the networking, security, FinOps, and observability product roadmap aligned with business goals
Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and user (internal) feedback to influence product decisions
Identify cost-saving opportunities through network optimization, automation, and cloud cost management strategies
Collaborate with public cloud, data, and AI teams to integrate Conversational AI with Employee Technologies, such as Genesys Cloud and CCaaS.
Define product strategy and requirements for Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) and Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) solutions, ensuring alignment with customer needs and compliance objectives.
Partner closely with engineering, security, and cloud teams to prioritize and deliver network observability capabilities, driving adoption of AI-driven analytics and performance optimization tools.
Lead product-driven FinOps initiatives by identifying cost-saving opportunities in cloud networking, collaborating cross-functionally to optimize resource utilization and improve overall cost efficiency.
Drive the roadmap and integration strategy for Conversational AI solutions within Genesys Cloud CCaaS platforms, emphasizing scalability, performance, and enhanced customer experiences.
Facilitate cross-functional alignment among engineering, finance, security, marketing, and sales to execute product launches, define go-to-market strategies, and clearly communicate progress and outcomes to executive stakeholders.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

5+ years of product management experience in owning products in networking, security, cloud, or FinOps.
Experience leading large-scale, cross-functional programs enabling over 1,000 users, with responsibility for change management, training, onboarding, and driving product adoption through clearly defined success metrics.
Working understanding or experience with Genesys Cloud, Conversational AI, and CCaaS solutions.
Knowledge of cloud networking (AWS, Azure, GCP) and hybrid cloud environments.
Familiarity with FinOps, cost-saving strategies, and cloud financial governance.
Knowledge of network automation, SD-WAN, SASE, VPNs, and security frameworks.
Experience working with network monitoring tools (Datadog, Splunk, New Relic, Prometheus, etc.).
Proven ability to drive cross-functional collaboration, roadmap execution, and product innovation.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (MBA is a plus).
Experience in network security, AI-driven observability, and incident response.
Knowledge of ZTNA vendors (Zscaler, Palo Alto, Cloudflare, etc.).
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible.
Strong understanding of Kubernetes networking and service mesh architectures.
Experience in B2B SaaS, FinOps strategies, and AI-driven networking solutions

Title: Workforce Planner
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Middle Mile Center in either Greensboro, NC or South Elgin, IL 
The Workforce Planner plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.
